thread.title: Clinton, Trump Are Both Wrong About Free Trade - Barron's
thread.title_full: Clinton, Trump Are Both Wrong About Free Trade - Barron's

title: Clinton, Trump Are Both Wrong About Free Trade - Barron's
text:
Barron's Cover Clinton, Trump Are Both Wrong About Free Trade The presidential candidates focus on the trade deficit in goods when they should consider the surplus in services and other benefits of free trade. By Biography August 20, 2016 
Free trade often comes under fire during presidential elections, laced with tough talk about spurning cheap Chinese imports—and not just from Donald Trump and Hillary Clinton. Seeking re-election in 2012, President Barack Obama baited Republican challenger Mitt Romney as “the last person who’s going to get tough on China” with respect to trade, while claiming credit for measures to ensure that “China was not flooding our domestic market with cheap tires.” Romney might have asked if it troubled Obama that, due to his actions, Americans were paying more for tires than they needed to. Instead, Romney lamely promised... Get The Full Story
